command.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the control of a group of people or a situation
command.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: By 1944, Fletcher had command of a B-17 bomber and a ten-man crew.
The fire officer took command, ordering everyone to leave the building.
troops under the command of General Roberts
Lieutenant Peters was now in command.
He felt fully in command of the situation.
Each congressman has a large staff at his command  (=available to be used).
command.translation[0].definitions[1].de: an order that should be obeyed
command.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Shoot when I give the command.
command.translation[0].definitions[2].de: an instruction to a computer to do something
command.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a part of an army, navy etc that is controlled separately and has a particular job
command.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: pilots of the Southern Air Command
command.translation[0].definitions[4].de: a group of officers or officials who give orders
command.translation[0].definitions[5].de: the group of soldiers that an officer is in control of
command.translation[0].note_box[0].headi: – Meaning 1: the control of a group of people or a situation
command.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The Colonel showed that he was in complete command of the situation.
Our company has a traditional management chain of command.
Athens had command of the oceans.
Captain Kent took command of the Emergency Control Centre.
He assumed command of all the troops in the Washington area.
A third goal put Brazil in command of the game.
The enemy was losing command of the situation.
The General was relieved of his command due to misconduct.
Their fighters had full command of the air over Pearl Harbor.
A large area was already under US military command.
Russia and Ukraine had joint command over the Fleet.
He was in sole command of a small military unit.
Each of our national defence forces has its own command structure.
command.translation[0].note_box[1].headi: – Meaning 2: an order that should be obeyed
command.translation[0].note_box[1].secti: The General gave the command to open fire.
Your dog will soon learn to obey your commands.
The men carried out the command immediately.
She just stands there barking commands while everyone works.
command.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to tell someone officially to do something, especially if you are a military leader, a king etc
command.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Captain Picard commanded the crew to report to the main deck.
The General commanded that the regiment attack at once.
command.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to be responsible for giving orders to a group of people in the army, navy etc
command.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to get something such as respect or attention because you do something well or are important or popular
command.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: Philip was a remarkable teacher, able to command instant respect.
Which graduates command the highest salaries?
command.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: The party that commands a majority of seats in Parliament forms the government.
command.translation[1].definitions[4].de: if a place commands a view, you can see something clearly from it
command.translation[1].definitions[4].ex: The Ramses Hilton commands a magnificent view of Cairo.
command.translation[2].definitions[0].de: an instruction given to a computer using the KEYBOARD or the MOUSE
command.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: When you have typed the document, use the save command to save it.
